subject: Business
title: Remote-First vs. Office Culture
description: A micro-lesson that makes Remote-First vs. Office Culture usable.

hook.text: GitLab has 2,000 employees in 65 countries and no office. They wrote a 2,000-page handbook.

buildup.text: Remote-first defaults to async communication, documented decisions, and written culture.

discovery.text: Offices optimize for spontaneity: hallway chats and whiteboards. Remote optimizes for deep work.

twist.text: Hybrid is the worst of both if done poorly. Remote people become second-class citizens.

climax.text: The key: choose one mode as the default and design every process around that choice.

punchline.text: Pick a mode. Then build every process to match it.

quiz.question: Why can hybrid work be the worst of both worlds?
options: Remote employees become second-class participants in meetings
It costs twice as much as either approach
Employees refuse to come to the office
